summary: creates a new user with a token
hierarchy: creates a new user with a token

summary: finds the existing user and resets the token
hierarchy: finds the existing user and resets the token

remoteObject.title: dependent destroy
remoteObject.body:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14348516/cascade-style-delete-in-mongoose

deleting a board should delete its columns

deleting a column should delete its cards

remoteObject.title: default board column order
remoteObject.body:
we're using Promise.spread to build our board columns but I falsely thought this meant it would happen in the correct order. it doesn't, it just waits for them all to resolve and spreads in the order i would expect, as far as arguments to the callback are concerned. refactor the static method in the board model to really build in the correct order.

proof of failure: https://strider.critiqueapp.com/keyvanfatehi/mib/job/53bb877be4ffc08b3f000628

remoteObject.title: login flow
remoteObject.body:
As @markhuge aptly pointed out, users may be turned off by the fact that we're not using Github's OAuth flow, i.e. we have users entering credentials directly into the app. I decided to remove the oauth flow to accomplish a pure API without web browser dependence so that it would be easy to build iOS/Android apps with tools like the ionicframework.

A solution is required that fits these requirements:

* Easy to create iOS/Android apps that consume the mib api, including 3rd party auth.
* Web users can still login with Github but this is done through OAuth flow.

remoteObject.title: socket.io
remoteObject.body: socket.io is already installed we just need to setup mongoose hooks to emit events and deal with them at the front

remoteObject.title: import not implemented
remoteObject.body:
we never re-implemented this after the huge refactor -- let's do this asap

use this export file: http://cl.ly/code/25330N3g1t2C

remoteObject.title: internal card provider
remoteObject.body: we want to do #23 but in order to do this, we must allow mib to be a standalone tool first -- this means, like our local auth provider, we must have an internal card provider -- essentially trello-like functionality.. this way mib is a horizontal tool. this gives us unlimited integration potential (ala Slack)

remoteObject.title: board url
remoteObject.body: do client-side (or server side even) routing directly to projects. make sure this URL is used and is visible.

remoteObject.title: make boards public
remoteObject.body:
after completing #41 we want to be able to share public boards so we'll need a way to make a board public or private, as far as just viewing is concerned.

this is very important so that open source projects can use the app

remoteObject.title: column lines and heights and drag behaviors
remoteObject.body:
- [ ] auto-set column height (css manip via javascript) to that of the tallest column at appropriate times. currently hardcoded to a huge number in the css file.
- [ ] put lines between columns
- [ ] dragging from the bottom of a super tall column into a pretty empty column is awkward
- [ ] dragging from the bottom of a super tall column into a specific part of a short column (offscreen) is basically impossible and requires multiple drags because you can't hold the card to the edge of the screen to scroll to the top... when in drag mode we can detect and apply the expected behavior to resolve this.

remoteObject.title: new cards should insert at the top
remoteObject.body: a new issue hookshot from github will deposit the card at the bottom of the icebox -- it should go to the top.

remoteObject.title: manual move to Done Column (role: 2) should hookshot Github
github card: more assignee features
remoteObject.body:
- [x] at the top right we show the avatar of the assignee.
- [ ] tooltip should show the username of the assignee
- [ ] click should show dropdown of collaborators to change assignee
- [ ] include "Unassign"

remoteObject.title: extract github support into a module
linker flow not working anymore
remoteObject.body: seems to have stopped working ever since refactoring some of the github stuff

remoteObject.title: release as upstream npm module
remoteObject.body: so that downstream can easily extend and profit

remoteObject.title: github: contextual edit
remoteObject.body: allow editing the card title from the board

remoteObject.title: apply provider labels
remoteObject.body:
use the provider's labels API to, when moving a card to a new column, remove the previous column name and assign the new column.name label to the issue

use prefix "mib:" to easily locate and change the labels

remoteObject.title: contextual new issue
remoteObject.body:
ability to create a card (and provider issue) from within the icebox.
be sure to apply label as described in #3

reason for this feature is that often i want to create issues referencing other issues, but i can't see them all on one page. mib will allow me to do that.

remoteObject.title: import should check mib: labels
remoteObject.body:
and put in/create the right columns

#3

remoteObject.title: github: refetch issues from github on load
remoteObject.body: issues can be edited at github. edits dont cause a webhook to fire. as such, to remain in sync, we must fetch the issues when the board is loaded.

remoteObject.title: github template: card stripes
remoteObject.body:
use github labels to show stripes on the card

hovering over should show the text of the label

remoteObject.title: link project must auto-add collaborators
remoteObject.body: new collaborators must be added through webhook, is there a webhook for this?

remoteObject.title: sortable dupe bug
remoteObject.body: it is possible to dupe cards at the backend

remoteObject.title: dependent destroy
remoteObject.body:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14348516/cascade-style-delete-in-mongoose

deleting a board should delete its columns

deleting a column should delete its cards

remoteObject.title: default board column order
remoteObject.body:
we're using Promise.spread to build our board columns but I falsely thought this meant it would happen in the correct order. it doesn't, it just waits for them all to resolve and spreads in the order i would expect, as far as arguments to the callback are concerned. refactor the static method in the board model to really build in the correct order.

proof of failure: https://strider.critiqueapp.com/keyvanfatehi/mib/job/53bb877be4ffc08b3f000628

remoteObject.title: login flow
remoteObject.body:
As @markhuge aptly pointed out, users may be turned off by the fact that we're not using Github's OAuth flow, i.e. we have users entering credentials directly into the app. I decided to remove the oauth flow to accomplish a pure API without web browser dependence so that it would be easy to build iOS/Android apps with tools like the ionicframework.

A solution is required that fits these requirements:

* Easy to create iOS/Android apps that consume the mib api, including 3rd party auth.
* Web users can still login with Github but this is done through OAuth flow.

remoteObject.title: socket.io
remoteObject.body: socket.io is already installed we just need to setup mongoose hooks to emit events and deal with them at the front

remoteObject.title: import not implemented
remoteObject.body:
we never re-implemented this after the huge refactor -- let's do this asap

use this export file: http://cl.ly/code/25330N3g1t2C

remoteObject.title: internal card provider
remoteObject.body: we want to do #23 but in order to do this, we must allow mib to be a standalone tool first -- this means, like our local auth provider, we must have an internal card provider -- essentially trello-like functionality.. this way mib is a horizontal tool. this gives us unlimited integration potential (ala Slack)

remoteObject.title: board url
remoteObject.body: do client-side (or server side even) routing directly to projects. make sure this URL is used and is visible.

remoteObject.title: make boards public
remoteObject.body:
after completing #41 we want to be able to share public boards so we'll need a way to make a board public or private, as far as just viewing is concerned.

this is very important so that open source projects can use the app

remoteObject.title: column lines and heights and drag behaviors
remoteObject.body:
- [ ] auto-set column height (css manip via javascript) to that of the tallest column at appropriate times. currently hardcoded to a huge number in the css file.
- [ ] put lines between columns
- [ ] dragging from the bottom of a super tall column into a pretty empty column is awkward
- [ ] dragging from the bottom of a super tall column into a specific part of a short column (offscreen) is basically impossible and requires multiple drags because you can't hold the card to the edge of the screen to scroll to the top... when in drag mode we can detect and apply the expected behavior to resolve this.

remoteObject.title: new cards should insert at the top
remoteObject.body: a new issue hookshot from github will deposit the card at the bottom of the icebox -- it should go to the top.

remoteObject.title: manual move to Done Column (role: 2) should hookshot Github
github card: more assignee features
remoteObject.body:
- [x] at the top right we show the avatar of the assignee.
- [ ] tooltip should show the username of the assignee
- [ ] click should show dropdown of collaborators to change assignee
- [ ] include "Unassign"

remoteObject.title: extract github support into a module
linker flow not working anymore
remoteObject.body: seems to have stopped working ever since refactoring some of the github stuff

remoteObject.title: release as upstream npm module
remoteObject.body: so that downstream can easily extend and profit

remoteObject.title: github: contextual edit
remoteObject.body: allow editing the card title from the board

remoteObject.title: apply provider labels
remoteObject.body:
use the provider's labels API to, when moving a card to a new column, remove the previous column name and assign the new column.name label to the issue

use prefix "mib:" to easily locate and change the labels

remoteObject.title: contextual new issue
remoteObject.body:
ability to create a card (and provider issue) from within the icebox.
be sure to apply label as described in #3

reason for this feature is that often i want to create issues referencing other issues, but i can't see them all on one page. mib will allow me to do that.

remoteObject.title: import should check mib: labels
remoteObject.body:
and put in/create the right columns

#3

remoteObject.title: github: refetch issues from github on load
remoteObject.body: issues can be edited at github. edits dont cause a webhook to fire. as such, to remain in sync, we must fetch the issues when the board is loaded.

remoteObject.title: github template: card stripes
remoteObject.body:
use github labels to show stripes on the card

hovering over should show the text of the label

remoteObject.title: link project must auto-add collaborators
remoteObject.body: new collaborators must be added through webhook, is there a webhook for this?

remoteObject.title: sortable dupe bug
remoteObject.body: it is possible to dupe cards at the backend

@markhuge aptly pointed out, users may be turned off by the fact that we're not using Github's OAuth flow, i.e. we have users entering credentials directly into the app. I decided to remove the oauth A solution is required that fits these requirements:

* Easy to create iOS/Android apps that consume the mib api, including 3rd party auth.
* Web users can still login with Github but this is done through OAuth remoteObject.title: dependent destroy
remoteObject.body:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14348516/cascade-style-delete-in-mongoose

deleting a board should delete its columns

deleting a column should delete its cards

remoteObject.title: default board column order
remoteObject.body:
we're using Promise.spread to build our board columns but I falsely thought this meant it would happen in the correct order. it doesn't, it just waits for them all to resolve and spreads in the order i would expect, as far as arguments to the callback are concerned. refactor the static method in the board model to really build in the correct order.

proof of failure: https://strider.critiqueapp.com/keyvanfatehi/mib/job/53bb877be4ffc08b3f000628

remoteObject.title: login flow
remoteObject.body:
As @markhuge aptly pointed out, users may be turned off by the fact that we're not using Github's OAuth flow, i.e. we have users entering credentials directly into the app. I decided to remove the oauth flow to accomplish a pure API without web browser dependence so that it would be easy to build iOS/Android apps with tools like the ionicframework.

A solution is required that fits these requirements:

* Easy to create iOS/Android apps that consume the mib api, including 3rd party auth.
* Web users can still login with Github but this is done through OAuth flow.

remoteObject.title: socket.io
remoteObject.body: socket.io is already installed we just need to setup mongoose hooks to emit events and deal with them at the front

remoteObject.title: import not implemented
remoteObject.body:
we never re-implemented this after the huge refactor -- let's do this asap

use this export file: http://cl.ly/code/25330N3g1t2C

remoteObject.title: internal card provider
remoteObject.body: we want to do #23 but in order to do this, we must allow mib to be a standalone tool first -- this means, like our local auth provider, we must have an internal card provider -- essentially trello-like functionality.. this way mib is a horizontal tool. this gives us unlimited integration potential (ala Slack)

remoteObject.title: board url
remoteObject.body: do client-side (or server side even) routing directly to projects. make sure this URL is used and is visible.

remoteObject.title: make boards public
remoteObject.body:
after completing #41 we want to be able to share public boards so we'll need a way to make a board public or private, as far as just viewing is concerned.

this is very important so that open source projects can use the app

remoteObject.title: column lines and heights and drag behaviors
remoteObject.body:
- [ ] auto-set column height (css manip via javascript) to that of the tallest column at appropriate times. currently hardcoded to a huge number in the css file.
- [ ] put lines between columns
- [ ] dragging from the bottom of a super tall column into a pretty empty column is awkward
- [ ] dragging from the bottom of a super tall column into a specific part of a short column (offscreen) is basically impossible and requires multiple drags because you can't hold the card to the edge of the screen to scroll to the top... when in drag mode we can detect and apply the expected behavior to resolve this.

remoteObject.title: new cards should insert at the top
remoteObject.body: a new issue hookshot from github will deposit the card at the bottom of the icebox -- it should go to the top.

remoteObject.title: manual move to Done Column (role: 2) should hookshot Github
github card: more assignee features
remoteObject.body:
- [x] at the top right we show the avatar of the assignee.
- [ ] tooltip should show the username of the assignee
- [ ] click should show dropdown of collaborators to change assignee
- [ ] include "Unassign"

remoteObject.title: extract github support into a module
linker flow not working anymore
remoteObject.body: seems to have stopped working ever since refactoring some of the github stuff

remoteObject.title: release as upstream npm module
remoteObject.body: so that downstream can easily extend and profit

remoteObject.title: github: contextual edit
remoteObject.body: allow editing the card title from the board

remoteObject.title: apply provider labels
remoteObject.body:
use the provider's labels API to, when moving a card to a new column, remove the previous column name and assign the new column.name label to the issue

use prefix "mib:" to easily locate and change the labels

remoteObject.title: contextual new issue
remoteObject.body:
ability to create a card (and provider issue) from within the icebox.
be sure to apply label as described in #3

reason for this feature is that often i want to create issues referencing other issues, but i can't see them all on one page. mib will allow me to do that.

remoteObject.title: import should check mib: labels
remoteObject.body:
and put in/create the right columns

#3

remoteObject.title: github: refetch issues from github on load
remoteObject.body: issues can be edited at github. edits dont cause a webhook to fire. as such, to remain in sync, we must fetch the issues when the board is loaded.

remoteObject.title: github template: card stripes
remoteObject.body:
use github labels to show stripes on the card

hovering over should show the text of the label

remoteObject.title: link project must auto-add collaborators
remoteObject.body: new collaborators must be added through webhook, is there a webhook for this?

remoteObject.title: sortable dupe bug
remoteObject.body: it is possible to dupe cards at the backend

A solution is required that fits these requirements:

* Easy to create iOS/Android apps that consume the mib api, including 3rd party auth.
* Web users can still login with Github but this is done through OAuth remoteObject.title: dependent destroy
remoteObject.body:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14348516/cascade-style-delete-in-mongoose

deleting a board should delete its columns

deleting a column should delete its cards

remoteObject.title: default board column order
remoteObject.body:
we're using Promise.spread to build our board columns but I falsely thought this meant it would happen in the correct order. it doesn't, it just waits for them all to resolve and spreads in the order i would expect, as far as arguments to the callback are concerned. refactor the static method in the board model to really build in the correct order.

proof of failure: https://strider.critiqueapp.com/keyvanfatehi/mib/job/53bb877be4ffc08b3f000628

remoteObject.title: login flow
remoteObject.body:
As @markhuge aptly pointed out, users may be turned off by the fact that we're not using Github's OAuth flow, i.e. we have users entering credentials directly into the app. I decided to remove the oauth flow to accomplish a pure API without web browser dependence so that it would be easy to build iOS/Android apps with tools like the ionicframework.

A solution is required that fits these requirements:

* Easy to create iOS/Android apps that consume the mib api, including 3rd party auth.
* Web users can still login with Github but this is done through OAuth flow.

remoteObject.title: socket.io
remoteObject.body: socket.io is already installed we just need to setup mongoose hooks to emit events and deal with them at the front

remoteObject.title: import not implemented
remoteObject.body:
we never re-implemented this after the huge refactor -- let's do this asap

use this export file: http://cl.ly/code/25330N3g1t2C

remoteObject.title: internal card provider
remoteObject.body: we want to do #23 but in order to do this, we must allow mib to be a standalone tool first -- this means, like our local auth provider, we must have an internal card provider -- essentially trello-like functionality.. this way mib is a horizontal tool. this gives us unlimited integration potential (ala Slack)

remoteObject.title: board url
remoteObject.body: do client-side (or server side even) routing directly to projects. make sure this URL is used and is visible.

remoteObject.title: make boards public
remoteObject.body:
after completing #41 we want to be able to share public boards so we'll need a way to make a board public or private, as far as just viewing is concerned.

this is very important so that open source projects can use the app

remoteObject.title: column lines and heights and drag behaviors
remoteObject.body:
- [ ] auto-set column height (css manip via javascript) to that of the tallest column at appropriate times. currently hardcoded to a huge number in the css file.
- [ ] put lines between columns
- [ ] dragging from the bottom of a super tall column into a pretty empty column is awkward
- [ ] dragging from the bottom of a super tall column into a specific part of a short column (offscreen) is basically impossible and requires multiple drags because you can't hold the card to the edge of the screen to scroll to the top... when in drag mode we can detect and apply the expected behavior to resolve this.

remoteObject.title: new cards should insert at the top
remoteObject.body: a new issue hookshot from github will deposit the card at the bottom of the icebox -- it should go to the top.

remoteObject.title: manual move to Done Column (role: 2) should hookshot Github
github card: more assignee features
remoteObject.body:
- [x] at the top right we show the avatar of the assignee.
- [ ] tooltip should show the username of the assignee
- [ ] click should show dropdown of collaborators to change assignee
- [ ] include "Unassign"

remoteObject.title: extract github support into a module
linker flow not working anymore
remoteObject.body: seems to have stopped working ever since refactoring some of the github stuff

remoteObject.title: release as upstream npm module
remoteObject.body: so that downstream can easily extend and profit

remoteObject.title: github: contextual edit
remoteObject.body: allow editing the card title from the board

remoteObject.title: apply provider labels
remoteObject.body:
use the provider's labels API to, when moving a card to a new column, remove the previous column name and assign the new column.name label to the issue

use prefix "mib:" to easily locate and change the labels

remoteObject.title: contextual new issue
remoteObject.body:
ability to create a card (and provider issue) from within the icebox.
be sure to apply label as described in #3

reason for this feature is that often i want to create issues referencing other issues, but i can't see them all on one page. mib will allow me to do that.

remoteObject.title: import should check mib: labels
remoteObject.body:
and put in/create the right columns

#3

remoteObject.title: github: refetch issues from github on load
remoteObject.body: issues can be edited at github. edits dont cause a webhook to fire. as such, to remain in sync, we must fetch the issues when the board is loaded.

remoteObject.title: github template: card stripes
remoteObject.body:
use github labels to show stripes on the card

hovering over should show the text of the label

remoteObject.title: link project must auto-add collaborators
remoteObject.body: new collaborators must be added through webhook, is there a webhook for this?

remoteObject.title: sortable dupe bug
remoteObject.body: it is possible to dupe cards at the backend

A solution is required that fits these requirements:

* Easy to create iOS/Android apps that consume the mib api, including 3rd party auth.
* Web users can still login with Github but this is done through OAuth remoteObject.title: dependent destroy
remoteObject.body:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14348516/cascade-style-delete-in-mongoose

deleting a board should delete its columns

deleting a column should delete its cards

remoteObject.title: default board column order
remoteObject.body:
we're using Promise.spread to build our board columns but I falsely thought this meant it would happen in the correct order. it doesn't, it just waits for them all to resolve and spreads in the order i would expect, as far as arguments to the callback are concerned. refactor the static method in the board model to really build in the correct order.

proof of failure: https://strider.critiqueapp.com/keyvanfatehi/mib/job/53bb877be4ffc08b3f000628

remoteObject.title: login flow
remoteObject.body:
As @markhuge aptly pointed out, users may be turned off by the fact that we're not using Github's OAuth flow, i.e. we have users entering credentials directly into the app. I decided to remove the oauth flow to accomplish a pure API without web browser dependence so that it would be easy to build iOS/Android apps with tools like the ionicframework.

A solution is required that fits these requirements:

* Easy to create iOS/Android apps that consume the mib api, including 3rd party auth.
* Web users can still login with Github but this is done through OAuth flow.

remoteObject.title: socket.io
remoteObject.body: socket.io is already installed we just need to setup mongoose hooks to emit events and deal with them at the front

remoteObject.title: import not implemented
remoteObject.body:
we never re-implemented this after the huge refactor -- let's do this asap

use this export file: http://cl.ly/code/25330N3g1t2C

remoteObject.title: internal card provider
remoteObject.body: we want to do #23 but in order to do this, we must allow mib to be a standalone tool first -- this means, like our local auth provider, we must have an internal card provider -- essentially trello-like functionality.. this way mib is a horizontal tool. this gives us unlimited integration potential (ala Slack)

remoteObject.title: board url
remoteObject.body: do client-side (or server side even) routing directly to projects. make sure this URL is used and is visible.

remoteObject.title: make boards public
remoteObject.body:
after completing #41 we want to be able to share public boards so we'll need a way to make a board public or private, as far as just viewing is concerned.

this is very important so that open source projects can use the app

remoteObject.title: column lines and heights and drag behaviors
remoteObject.body:
- [ ] auto-set column height (css manip via javascript) to that of the tallest column at appropriate times. currently hardcoded to a huge number in the css file.
- [ ] put lines between columns
- [ ] dragging from the bottom of a super tall column into a pretty empty column is awkward
- [ ] dragging from the bottom of a super tall column into a specific part of a short column (offscreen) is basically impossible and requires multiple drags because you can't hold the card to the edge of the screen to scroll to the top... when in drag mode we can detect and apply the expected behavior to resolve this.

remoteObject.title: new cards should insert at the top
remoteObject.body: a new issue hookshot from github will deposit the card at the bottom of the icebox -- it should go to the top.

remoteObject.title: manual move to Done Column (role: 2) should hookshot Github
github card: more assignee features
remoteObject.body:
- [x] at the top right we show the avatar of the assignee.
- [ ] tooltip should show the username of the assignee
- [ ] click should show dropdown of collaborators to change assignee
- [ ] include "Unassign"

remoteObject.title: extract github support into a module
linker flow not working anymore
remoteObject.body: seems to have stopped working ever since refactoring some of the github stuff

remoteObject.title: release as upstream npm module
remoteObject.body: so that downstream can easily extend and profit

remoteObject.title: github: contextual edit
remoteObject.body: allow editing the card title from the board

remoteObject.title: apply provider labels
remoteObject.body:
use the provider's labels API to, when moving a card to a new column, remove the previous column name and assign the new column.name label to the issue

use prefix "mib:" to easily locate and change the labels

remoteObject.title: contextual new issue
remoteObject.body:
ability to create a card (and provider issue) from within the icebox.
be sure to apply label as described in #3

reason for this feature is that often i want to create issues referencing other issues, but i can't see them all on one page. mib will allow me to do that.

remoteObject.title: import should check mib: labels
remoteObject.body:
and put in/create the right columns

#3

remoteObject.title: github: refetch issues from github on load
remoteObject.body: issues can be edited at github. edits dont cause a webhook to fire. as such, to remain in sync, we must fetch the issues when the board is loaded.

remoteObject.title: github template: card stripes
remoteObject.body:
use github labels to show stripes on the card

hovering over should show the text of the label

remoteObject.title: link project must auto-add collaborators
remoteObject.body: new collaborators must be added through webhook, is there a webhook for this?

remoteObject.title: sortable dupe bug
remoteObject.body: it is possible to dupe cards at the backend

A solution is required that fits these requirements:

* Easy to create iOS/Android apps that consume the mib api, including 3rd party auth.
* Web users can still login with Github but this is done through OAuth remoteObject.title: dependent destroy
remoteObject.body:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14348516/cascade-style-delete-in-mongoose

deleting a board should delete its columns

deleting a column should delete its cards

remoteObject.title: default board column order
remoteObject.body:
we're using Promise.spread to build our board columns but I falsely thought this meant it would happen in the correct order. it doesn't, it just waits for them all to resolve and spreads in the order i would expect, as far as arguments to the callback are concerned. refactor the static method in the board model to really build in the correct order.

proof of failure: https://strider.critiqueapp.com/keyvanfatehi/mib/job/53bb877be4ffc08b3f000628

remoteObject.title: login flow
remoteObject.body:
As @markhuge aptly pointed out, users may be turned off by the fact that we're not using Github's OAuth flow, i.e. we have users entering credentials directly into the app. I decided to remove the oauth flow to accomplish a pure API without web browser dependence so that it would be easy to build iOS/Android apps with tools like the ionicframework.

A solution is required that fits these requirements:

* Easy to create iOS/Android apps that consume the mib api, including 3rd party auth.
* Web users can still login with Github but this is done through OAuth flow.

remoteObject.title: socket.io
remoteObject.body: socket.io is already installed we just need to setup mongoose hooks to emit events and deal with them at the front

remoteObject.title: import not implemented
remoteObject.body:
we never re-implemented this after the huge refactor -- let's do this asap

use this export file: http://cl.ly/code/25330N3g1t2C

remoteObject.title: internal card provider
remoteObject.body: we want to do #23 but in order to do this, we must allow mib to be a standalone tool first -- this means, like our local auth provider, we must have an internal card provider -- essentially trello-like functionality.. this way mib is a horizontal tool. this gives us unlimited integration potential (ala Slack)

remoteObject.title: board url
remoteObject.body: do client-side (or server side even) routing directly to projects. make sure this URL is used and is visible.

remoteObject.title: make boards public
remoteObject.body:
after completing #41 we want to be able to share public boards so we'll need a way to make a board public or private, as far as just viewing is concerned.

this is very important so that open source projects can use the app

remoteObject.title: column lines and heights and drag behaviors
remoteObject.body:
- [ ] auto-set column height (css manip via javascript) to that of the tallest column at appropriate times. currently hardcoded to a huge number in the css file.
- [ ] put lines between columns
- [ ] dragging from the bottom of a super tall column into a pretty empty column is awkward
- [ ] dragging from the bottom of a super tall column into a specific part of a short column (offscreen) is basically impossible and requires multiple drags because you can't hold the card to the edge of the screen to scroll to the top... when in drag mode we can detect and apply the expected behavior to resolve this.

remoteObject.title: new cards should insert at the top
remoteObject.body: a new issue hookshot from github will deposit the card at the bottom of the icebox -- it should go to the top.

remoteObject.title: manual move to Done Column (role: 2) should hookshot Github
github card: more assignee features
remoteObject.body:
- [x] at the top right we show the avatar of the assignee.
- [ ] tooltip should show the username of the assignee
- [ ] click should show dropdown of collaborators to change assignee
- [ ] include "Unassign"

remoteObject.title: extract github support into a module
linker flow not working anymore
remoteObject.body: seems to have stopped working ever since refactoring some of the github stuff

remoteObject.title: release as upstream npm module
remoteObject.body: so that downstream can easily extend and profit

remoteObject.title: github: contextual edit
remoteObject.body: allow editing the card title from the board

remoteObject.title: apply provider labels
remoteObject.body:
use the provider's labels API to, when moving a card to a new column, remove the previous column name and assign the new column.name label to the issue

use prefix "mib:" to easily locate and change the labels

remoteObject.title: contextual new issue
remoteObject.body:
ability to create a card (and provider issue) from within the icebox.
be sure to apply label as described in #3

reason for this feature is that often i want to create issues referencing other issues, but i can't see them all on one page. mib will allow me to do that.

remoteObject.title: import should check mib: labels
remoteObject.body:
and put in/create the right columns

#3

remoteObject.title: github: refetch issues from github on load
remoteObject.body: issues can be edited at github. edits dont cause a webhook to fire. as such, to remain in sync, we must fetch the issues when the board is loaded.

remoteObject.title: github template: card stripes
remoteObject.body:
use github labels to show stripes on the card

hovering over should show the text of the label

remoteObject.title: link project must auto-add collaborators
remoteObject.body: new collaborators must be added through webhook, is there a webhook for this?

remoteObject.title: sortable dupe bug
remoteObject.body: it is possible to dupe cards at the backend

A solution is required that fits these requirements:

* Easy to create iOS/Android apps that consume the mib api, including 3rd party auth.
* Web users can still login with Github but this is done through OAuth remoteObject.title: dependent destroy
remoteObject.body:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14348516/cascade-style-delete-in-mongoose

deleting a board should delete its columns

deleting a column should delete its cards

remoteObject.title: default board column order
remoteObject.body:
we're using Promise.spread to build our board columns but I falsely thought this meant it would happen in the correct order. it doesn't, it just waits for them all to resolve and spreads in the order i would expect, as far as arguments to the callback are concerned. refactor the static method in the board model to really build in the correct order.

proof of failure: https://strider.critiqueapp.com/keyvanfatehi/mib/job/53bb877be4ffc08b3f000628

remoteObject.title: login flow
remoteObject.body:
As @markhuge aptly pointed out, users may be turned off by the fact that we're not using Github's OAuth flow, i.e. we have users entering credentials directly into the app. I decided to remove the oauth flow to accomplish a pure API without web browser dependence so that it would be easy to build iOS/Android apps with tools like the ionicframework.

A solution is required that fits these requirements:

* Easy to create iOS/Android apps that consume the mib api, including 3rd party auth.
* Web users can still login with Github but this is done through OAuth flow.

remoteObject.title: socket.io
remoteObject.body: socket.io is already installed we just need to setup mongoose hooks to emit events and deal with them at the front

remoteObject.title: import not implemented
remoteObject.body:
we never re-implemented this after the huge refactor -- let's do this asap

use this export file: http://cl.ly/code/25330N3g1t2C

remoteObject.title: internal card provider
remoteObject.body: we want to do #23 but in order to do this, we must allow mib to be a standalone tool first -- this means, like our local auth provider, we must have an internal card provider -- essentially trello-like functionality.. this way mib is a horizontal tool. this gives us unlimited integration potential (ala Slack)

remoteObject.title: board url
remoteObject.body: do client-side (or server side even) routing directly to projects. make sure this URL is used and is visible.

remoteObject.title: make boards public
remoteObject.body:
after completing #41 we want to be able to share public boards so we'll need a way to make a board public or private, as far as just viewing is concerned.

this is very important so that open source projects can use the app

remoteObject.title: column lines and heights and drag behaviors
remoteObject.body:
- [ ] auto-set column height (css manip via javascript) to that of the tallest column at appropriate times. currently hardcoded to a huge number in the css file.
- [ ] put lines between columns
- [ ] dragging from the bottom of a super tall column into a pretty empty column is awkward
- [ ] dragging from the bottom of a super tall column into a specific part of a short column (offscreen) is basically impossible and requires multiple drags because you can't hold the card to the edge of the screen to scroll to the top... when in drag mode we can detect and apply the expected behavior to resolve this.

remoteObject.title: new cards should insert at the top
remoteObject.body: a new issue hookshot from github will deposit the card at the bottom of the icebox -- it should go to the top.

remoteObject.title: manual move to Done Column (role: 2) should hookshot Github
github card: more assignee features
remoteObject.body:
- [x] at the top right we show the avatar of the assignee.
- [ ] tooltip should show the username of the assignee
- [ ] click should show dropdown of collaborators to change assignee
- [ ] include "Unassign"

remoteObject.title: extract github support into a module
linker flow not working anymore
remoteObject.body: seems to have stopped working ever since refactoring some of the github stuff

remoteObject.title: release as upstream npm module
remoteObject.body: so that downstream can easily extend and profit

remoteObject.title: github: contextual edit
remoteObject.body: allow editing the card title from the board

remoteObject.title: apply provider labels
remoteObject.body:
use the provider's labels API to, when moving a card to a new column, remove the previous column name and assign the new column.name label to the issue

use prefix "mib:" to easily locate and change the labels

remoteObject.title: contextual new issue
remoteObject.body:
ability to create a card (and provider issue) from within the icebox.
be sure to apply label as described in #3

reason for this feature is that often i want to create issues referencing other issues, but i can't see them all on one page. mib will allow me to do that.

remoteObject.title: import should check mib: labels
remoteObject.body:
and put in/create the right columns

#3

remoteObject.title: github: refetch issues from github on load
remoteObject.body: issues can be edited at github. edits dont cause a webhook to fire. as such, to remain in sync, we must fetch the issues when the board is loaded.

remoteObject.title: github template: card stripes
remoteObject.body:
use github labels to show stripes on the card

hovering over should show the text of the label

remoteObject.title: link project must auto-add collaborators
remoteObject.body: new collaborators must be added through webhook, is there a webhook for this?

remoteObject.title: sortable dupe bug
remoteObject.body: it is possible to dupe cards at the backend

A solution is required that fits these requirements:

* Easy to create iOS/Android apps that consume the mib api, including 3rd party auth.
* Web users can still login with Github but this is done through OAuth
